name: Hooded Vulture
description: The Hooded Vulture is a small scavenger with a bare head, known for its adaptability.
food_note: Thrives in varied environments, including near human settlements.
proportions: Wingspan: 1.7-2 m, length: 65-75 cm, weight: 1.5-2.6 kg.
reproduction: Lays 1 egg in a tree nest, incubation about 40 days.
attractions: Common in zoos for their scavenging role.
projects_note: Endangered due to poisoning and habitat loss; conservation is active.
